etymology.description: 地 (land; place) + 区/區 (area; division) = region; area; district
etymology.interpretation: Combines a general sense of land/place with a unit of division to denote a defined part of a larger space. Used for geographic regions, administrative districts, or functional zones depending on context.
etymology.simplification: 區 → 区 by adopting an older/variant form with fewer strokes; 地 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 这个地区人口密集(這個地區人口密集)。
我们在沿海地区发展旅游业(我們在沿海地區發展旅遊業)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài yánhǎi dìqū fāzhǎn lǚyóu yè.
examples.english: We develop the tourism industry in coastal areas.

examples.chinese: 政府将根据各地区的需求分配资源(政府將根據各地區的需求分配資源)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ jiāng gēnjù gè dìqū de xūqiú fēnpèi zīyuán.
examples.english: The government will allocate resources according to the needs of each region.
